positive.review: Gameplay is quite repetitive. Combat system seems quite lackluster compared to other games. Basically no storyline. 6/10

Aseprite is one of the best pixel art apps in existence. It's a good, affordable art application that is dedicated to pixel art. Other more general art/illustration apps like Photoshop, Krita, GIMP, Clip Studio Paint, etc can do similar pixel art things, but it's nice to have an editor SPECIFICALLY designed for pixel art rather than pixel art abilities being tacked on to an otherwise large suite. Basically, there's just less feature-creep in dedicated software such as this, which is nice for people who just want a plug-and-play solution for pixel art.

All the tools you are used to in other general image manipulation software is here, along with cool things like a timeline. Performance wise it's pretty good! It also works on Linux (I'm using Linux Mint 21.3 cinnamon) which is awesome too.

Aseprite is one of those programs that just gets out of your way and lets you create. The interface is clean, the tools make sense, and everything feels snappy. I’ve tried other pixel art editors before, but Aseprite is the first one where I didn’t feel like I was fighting the software just to draw a line.

Animation is where it really shines. The timeline is simple but powerful, onion skinning works exactly how you expect, and making small adjustments frame-by-frame feels surprisingly smooth instead of tedious. You can tell the people who made this actually use it themselves.

It also runs great. No random lag, no weird crashes—just reliable, consistent performance. And little things like the color palette tools, custom brushes, and the overall workflow make a big difference once you start using it regularly.

If you’re into pixel art, whether you’re working on a game or just messing around, Aseprite is absolutely worth it. It’s one of those rare tools that makes creating fun instead of frustrating. Honestly, I wish more software was built this cleanly.

5/5, no complaints.
Very convenient for pixel painting on different platforms.
Very solid beginner friendly pixelart making tool and very worth the price tag with the features you get and the frequent updates and bug fixing it still gets to this day

Disregard the steam time, I bought Aseprite on Humble Bundle and only installed it on steam today. This software has proven great for a vast majority of my image-related tasks over years and is generally just pretty stable.

Cannot recommend this enough; one of the most GOATed graphic design softwares in existence. There's so much value there you have no idea. Get this already if you are going to work with pixels and animations of the such. Even for general doodling, this is fantastic. 9999/10
it's good for pixel art, not great for non pixel art. If you want to make pixel art get this one
the perfect pixel art app! its very easy to use and theres lots of tutorials online. it works well with godot if you download plugins but isnt necessary.
Its hands down the best pixel art program. Libresprite is ok, but Asesprite has way more features and better file selection.

Just as good as my art is bad. 

Coming to this from years of Pyxel Edit is a huge change, but has so many features it's well worth the switch. I do wish the color palette was a little more malleable and using the tiling functions weren't quite so obfuscated, but that's largely because that was Pyxel Edit's only strong points that I wish I could bring along.
it's pretty good, serviceable art software that I tend to use for both pixel and non-pixel art due to how innovative it feels.
only stopped pirating it cuz steam version had dark theme but it turned out to be better overall as well lol
It's freaking good. Simple and effective. Industry standard.

Amazing, robust, user friendly, so easy to use that I didn't give up. After nearly 1600 hours you'd think I was an expert pixel artist, or even a great novice. I'm not, but that's certainly more on me than the software.
Simple to learn the basics. Plenty of tools that make creating art fast and effectively. Intuitive keyboard shortcuts. Love it!

I don't have ton of experience with pixel art programs, but Aseprite seems to have everything it needs for pixel art creation for art and for animation in videogames.  I find it reasonably (if not overly) intuitive and can get to actually making art pretty much immediately. It does layers which is very helpful in any art program.  It imports and exports palettes which is handy and helpful.  The fact that you are paying for it means it is at least somewhat more likely to get updates and bug fixes, so that too is helpful.

pretty good program if you like making pixel art, has almost everything youd need
ive used this for multiple years and honestly its perfect, my only gripe is that you cant use reference audio for animations, then again you can just use plugins to do that which is nice

oh yea, this program is pretty customizable, with themes and customizable editor interface (in beta at time of review) and you can even do some neat stuff with lua scripts and plugins

so yea, if you're looking for a nice pixel art program then this is pretty good. my rate is 10/10

I bought this software to help with my pixel art game dev dreams but honestly this is the best sprite sheet maker EVER. It will handle my huge digital art canvases to turn them into gifs and sprite sheets for my projects like a CHAMP. Honestly for the export to sprite sheet feature alone I would buy this software again. Yes it is the best pixel art software I have ever used but for me - nothing beats the export to sprite sheet and gif making capabilities.

This pixel art program is relaxing on the eyes and deep with function.
* Pixel perfect control in painting, selection, and transparency, that does not blur.
* Hot keys galore, and helpful tool tips.
* Relevant tool customization is on screen.
* Not too expensive.
* Fun to use.
5 STARS
The only thing that could make it better is if was also a game builder, 
but that's just a fantasy.
Definitely helpful for modding games like The Binding Of Isaac Rebirth or any pixel games, overall just fun to work with.
so far the only complete project i've made was just this basic slashing weapon, but i'm enjoying using this so far.

A must have for anyone looking to make pixel art especially animations! I left my usual drawing program to making pixel art in this exclusively it's all you need and more, the quality of life tools really help the process while keeping it simple :) Plus the layout has a fun older pixel vibe.
Quite a big price tag, but totally worth it if your really looking to get into pixel art
amazing for pixel art!! has many good tools and layers and even animation, many different file types.
used it for a little bit and gotta say, it's pretty good
Aseprite is great for getting into 2d Sprite creation.
Perfect, simple, quick and to the point. Very useful for game dev, or anything pixel art related
This app gets super fun with all the pixel are and all the animation and i would say its worth my money :D

this game is delightfully made my briish ahh fight demons! but without the fighting demons part and its just a pain to use, i still recommends tho

i like guys btw
I like using it for making mini animations for sprites! It is super simple to use and great for game development or if you just want to make pixel art. 10/10.
Draw?
simple to use. features are good. great for pixel editing by hand. I use it all the time. you can add user-made tools. +++

Weird game where you have to draw your own map and characters and all the other stuff, and even after all that it you still have to draw more stuff for the game.

You even get real money from other people when you completed the quest they gave you, I'm not sure how to find those people, usually they come from DM like a surprise event irl.

Despite all the flaw and weirdness of this game I like it
its very helpful but requires a bit of time to figure out all the features and how to use them. other then that the pen is in your hands and practice is a requirment to progress
Best pixel art software in the biz, in my opinion. I have used it for many different projects and general art use for many years.
the best pixel art platform to exist, highly customisable with community themes and mods, simple to use export + save buttons for spritesheets. 10/10

The jump to piskel to aseprite was insane.
aseprite has many useful tools that alot of other pixel art programs dont provide and is still being worked on. the text feature could be worked on a bit but all in all its more than worth the $20
GREAT FOR PIXELART (especially minecraft textures) is just great

Don't let my playtime fool you, I've used this program more offline than online. I can confidently say its one of, if not the best, applications that I've used for pixel art. Easy to learn and use. There is also the ability to use custom scripts and addons that help me in my personal workflow.

If you are able to I'd recommend picking this up especially if it's on sale.

Some of the best software I have ever bought. Open source, multiplatform, betas kept for older devices?!? This is perfect for my use of tech, and it's very multipurpose, from game development and modding, to pixel animation, or even normal art! Needless to say, for $20, this may be one of the only art programs I'll ever need. Thank you.
I mean... if you want to make pixel art for fun or actually make a game, cant pass this up. Literally nothing bad, just get it.

I've been using this software for the graphic design of my board game, and it does a great job. I like to use the animation tools for helping make all the cards, and it has all the layering and features that I require. And, it supports scripting, which made it possible to have a Lua Script do all the exporting of my cards automatically. Super big time saver!
Great tool. If you like MSpaint, this is just MSpaint but bigger and better and awesomer. You can do anything with aseprite and thats cool and awesome. Would reccomend 10/10

Very robust. Great for making sprites and animations. Not exactly hard to learn, but there is a lot to understand to develop competence and a fluid workflow. 

The premium app for pixel art creation.

Una de las formas mas cómodas de crear ilustraciones y animaciones en PixelArt.
Lo único que echo de menos es una función nativa para grabar timelapses (Puedes instalar plugins externos para hacerlo)

Don't pay for this software, it's literally given out for free. Especially don't buy it on steam, cause then you need internet for it to work. Great piece of software, just don't make the mistake of buying it.
Super beginneer friendly and pro friendly literally super easy to use and make sharp animation

Easily my favorite piece of software ever made. 
I can't believe it's still getting updated with cool new features AND WITHOUT CRAMMING IN RANDOM BUZZWORD AI SHIT WHAAAT?!
A simple, but effective tool for pixel artists alike

Great program so far. The only negative thing I have to say about it is the lack of UI customizability. The only thing you can move around is the timeline (which is somewhat hidden, especially if you're new) and the preview window. The toolbar being on the right side is a little uncomfortable for me with the way I have my tablet set up on my desk.
Amazing software, easy to use and very versatile :)
absolute cinema. best thing to have ever happened for pixel art community,
Incredible pixel art editor with a lot of handy tools and even a tilemapping function. Highly recommend!
Aseprite is an incredibly useful and intuitive tool for making sprite art! Within a week, I was making animated sprites I could use without even looking at a tutorial!
State of the art pixel art tool. There is no better alternative.
This is a great app for pixel art with a large array of tools included. Completely worth the price
Aseprite is very user friendly with simple UI but very powerful app for creating pixel art. Highly recommend! It's worth the money. <3

As someone who has zero knowledge in pixel art, Buying this software helped me immensely with my personal projects and through it, i was able to create cool stuff. 10/10 would recommend. I would love if a measuring tool was added(if there isn't one) however.

Figured it was about time to write a review.

I wouldn't have started pixel art without aseprite, if that doesn't tell you to go for this software after 3K+ hours I don't know what will.

So yes, take the plunge, learn pixel art, buy aseprite.
Just started trying the program and is absolutely easy to learn! Definitely recommended
A really beginner friendly program that works extremely well for drawing pixel art. Would recommend for this price.

This software is free. I'm just saying that you can get it for free off the github.
Anyways, this is actually a really good pixel art software. I don't have much to say about it, yeah its really good. But this is here if you want to give the developers money (Which I had no idea they had it free, and I paid for this for no reason LMAO)
most peak software to ever exist (other than chess) and also banjo

Best art program around, imo. Even with some issues on my specific Linux build, I'd be hard pressed to find something better, esp for pixel art. Loads of developers have awful EULA's and condone art theft nowadays to promote AI learning. This is a nicely curated fork of LibreSprite; and I've supported this developer for ages. I bought it on here because I got tired of dealing with other distributors, but need my tools..! Highly recommend this application for anyone who needs an art program.
The perfect app for making pixel art and pixel animations! It has all the tools needed, tons of nice built-in color palettes, I especially love the pixel perfect tool when drawing with a brush!

I'm not a pro or a master artist, but I've spent my fair share of time using Aseprite, and have nothing but good things to say!

It has all of the basic tools you'd need for drawing, plus plenty more handy features that I have yet to familiarize myself with. The support for animated projects is also quite handy, especially for entry-level artists.
Awesome software for any art, but pixel art changed dramatically for me after I started using Aseprite 10/10.
An invaluable application for those who enjoy the idea of doing pixel art and/or animations.
Very good pixel art and animation and everything number 1 best ever
I don't have a lot of experience as an artist, but it's still very easy for me to make little animations with this.
great for making pixel art and cross stitch patterns
its basically pixel art if you took the art and made pixels
Works great for pixel art. I only wish there was a native audio track to make animations easier

пиксельный ништячок
в общем кайфовый интерфейс. рисуем и анимируем╰(*°▽°*)╯

I have not used this software to its full potential, but Aesprite is great if you want to do pixel art. The UI is amazing and the tools are on par. The community support for this software is amazing, allowing you to find a tutorial for anything that confuses you. So if you want to do pixel art or want to hop into the world of Game Dev then you should consider buying this software.
Best pixel art software for the price, enough said

VERY COOL PIXEL ART MAKER

MADE VERY COOL PLANETS VERY FAST IT WAS COOL

YIPPEE YIPPEE YIPPEE

Amazing tool!
It's got pretty much anything anyone would ever need: layers, spritesheet making, animation, tilesets, palette presets, several different brush behaviors, dithering buckets, normal mapping, a whole lot of exporting options and several more things I'll keep discovering over time
Despite having a huge toolset, the UI is very intuitive and simple, and a lot of hotkey that feel very natural right away for power users
Most of the app is customizable to some degree, so you can adapt your workspace to basically anything you need
I've been doing pixel art for about 6 years now, but my level really went up once I took a small course and started using this app and its features a little over two years ago
Absolutely one of my best buys ever
Great and Linux compatible
Very useful tool for making pixel art games I'd say.
I really like this software for making a pixel art, its very worth it to buy for you if you wanna make pixel animation or games

so you can build aseprite for free but im too simpleminded to keep doing that when i wanna update the program so i just bought this for simplicity;s sake, plus your supporting the studio and its a good program with lots of community made content to help you make pixel art better. Unfortunately all I do with this program is draw furry art.

A true lifesaver.
My only problem is with the price.
The cost is worth it, whether you want to make pixel art or not.
amazing software, cant go wrong for pixel art
If you wanna learn pixel art, this program is a great place to start! Highly recommend it!
Really good art program & I love its animation features!
Great software for pixel art, I use it a lot!
one of the best software to use getting into pixel art
Yes, I may have a slight problem. And no... I am not open to feedback.
Very easy to use and helpful software
Perfect for creating a Minecraft Resource pack!
Better than Microsoft paint, I can give you that!
If you are even a little bit interested in making pixel art, Aseprite is worth every penny.

Overall best pixel art software, the lua scripting side of and CLI functionality might be the best feature for workflow automation for whatever needs. If you don't care about it it's just a great one and done purchase for all your pixel art needs. The hotkeys and layout feel well made and don't feel overwhelming as well as if you want to visually customize it you can find all sorts of lovely layouts for your preference.

Personally my favorite art making program for doing any sprites, tilemaps, etcs. It's [i]THE[/i] pixel art software.
this game's difficulty is way too high, i'm still bad at it
would recommend! a little overpriced but... oh well
Fantastic software for making pixel art. But I also use it for high resolution photo editing.
I always forget I have this until I need it. Great for pixel art.

negative.review: The Chinese characters are way too large, even overflowing their containers and getting clipped. The screen scaling and UI element scaling settings are just terrible — no matter how you combine them, everything ends up either too big or too small.

Can't install plugins on Linux. I'm trying to use Retro Diffusion plugin I bought and used to use on Windows. I don't use Windows anymore and can't install Retro Diffusion because it can't find git. Tried workarounds to break it out of the container and symlink git from a place it can access, but still doesn't work. UX is really terrible for file browsing too. Just because it is a pixel art app it should not look like pixel art it is difficult to use, so you get a bad review.

Pixelorama is Waaay better than this.
Somehow I never clicked with aseprite, the user interface feels clunky to me. But it does have nice and useful community made plugins.

It alright, but for $20 I would expect more options instead of everything just being crude, caveman ways of doing things. Good software, but NOT for $20, wait for it to go on sale, or sail the pirate seas ;)

While it's a good drawing app (I use it all the time), it is very weird with how it does things. For one, it can crash randomly when you try to use slice, it can prevent you from drawing on recovered sprites, it always uploads to it's own Program Files folder (which I have to change manually to Downloads), etc etc, and all in all, it is very annoying to deal with when these things commonly happen.
Bugged, there is a %50 chance to get stuck in move tool, makes the app unusable. Restarting doesn't work. Hoping for an alternative.

The Chinese characters are way too large, even overflowing their containers and getting clipped. The screen scaling and UI element scaling settings are just terrible — no matter how you combine them, everything ends up either too big or too small.

Can't install plugins on Linux. I'm trying to use Retro Diffusion plugin I bought and used to use on Windows. I don't use Windows anymore and can't install Retro Diffusion because it can't find git. Tried workarounds to break it out of the container and symlink git from a place it can access, but still doesn't work. UX is really terrible for file browsing too. Just because it is a pixel art app it should not look like pixel art it is difficult to use, so you get a bad review.

Pixelorama is Waaay better than this.

Tried workarounds to break it out of the container and symlink git from a place it can access, but still doesn't work. UX is really terrible for file browsing too. Just because it is a pixel art app it should not look like pixel art it is difficult to use, so you get a bad review.

Pixelorama is Waaay better than this.
Somehow I never clicked with aseprite, the user interface feels clunky to me. But it does have nice and useful community made plugins.

It alright, but for $20 I would expect more options instead of everything just being crude, caveman ways of doing things. Good software, but NOT for $20, wait for it to go on sale, or sail the pirate seas ;)

While it's a good drawing app (I use it all the time), it is very weird with how it does things. For one, it can crash randomly when you try to use slice, it can prevent you from drawing on recovered sprites, it always uploads to it's own Program Files folder (which I have to change manually to Downloads), etc etc, and all in all, it is very annoying to deal with when these things commonly happen.
Bugged, there is a %50 chance to get stuck in move tool, makes the app unusable. Restarting doesn't work. Hoping for an alternative.

The Chinese characters are way too large, even overflowing their containers and getting clipped. The screen scaling and UI element scaling settings are just terrible — no matter how you combine them, everything ends up either too big or too small.
